answers.answer: Forgot to mention, nerve conduction study did show ulnar nerve neuopathy (mild slowing) in both elbows.  And I really feel that too.  :/

question: It all started Aug 06. One toe got numb, then the others and then it progressed to a glove and stocking distribution of burning pain.  It waxes and wanes.  Dec. 06 I had could barely press the brake pedal in my car.  I was 30.  Fast forward....I've seen every specialist known to man and these are the only abnormal results:  2006:  One lesion on corpus callosum on several MRIs with and without contrast, brain and spinal cord.  Small spike in serum protein electrophoresis with Impression of:  "Apparent polycolonal gammopathy".  Neurologist said it was nothing but a "hiccup".  2009:  Positive ELISA for Lyme at Johns Hopkins.  Negative Western Blot.  Positive Western Blot by Ignenex Labs (a "specialty" lab for Lyme).  Johns Hopkins wrote me off as "post viral syndrome" and has never given up their Western Blot results paperwork (?).Small fiber skin punch biopsy reads:  Normal nerve fiber density.  Morphology:  excessive branching and segmenting.  What does that mean??  After finding a doctor that would treat me for Lyme, he prescribed oral antibiotics for 6 months.  I improved greatly, however, it waxed and waned anyway.  So I don't know if the treatment worked or it was a natural lull in my "cycle" of pain.  Then I got pregnant.  ALL symptoms went away and I felt awesome during pregnancy.  When my daughter was seven months old, the symptoms came back.  I feel completely defeated and I'm in so much pain, I don't know how I'll make it thru another day of work.  At present, my feet burn, my ankles, sometimes calves and other places.  Fasciculations all over.  It makes me tired.  I'm on antibiotics again (2 months into it) with my Lyme dr. and I don't see any improvement yet.  My shrink suggested somatization disorder - but why the abnormal skin punch biopsy then??  I don't think it's somatization disorder and, in fact, it ticked me off ( no pun intended ) that he decided that's what I have.  Truth is, who does?  I've given up and I'm going to a pain clinic on Friday.  I'm taking Pamelor and I'm still in pain, tried Lyrica/Cymbalta/Neurontin/Elavil.  I need help, if any can be given.Negative tests were:Spinal tapVEPBAER3hr GTT (no diabetes)every labwork imagineable except positives mentioned aboveMRI to look for herniated disksNerve Conduction Studies of all Extremitiesand on and on...
title: Small Fiber Neuropathy and Fasciculations?  Lyme
